title: Calories in 6 Ounces of Salmon
meta_description: Discover calories in 6 ounces of salmon, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Atlantic farmed salmon, cooked (baked or grilled), skinless, no added oil, salt, or seasonings; 6 oz â‰ˆ 170 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by salmon type (wild vs. farmed), cooking method, portion accuracy, and added ingredients. Check labels or sources when available.

quick_answer.text: 6 ounces of cooked salmon offers ~350 kcal and ~38 g protein.

label_note: Totals are scaled from the per-100 g basis and mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to wild salmon (lower fat content)
Add 1 tsp olive oil for cooking per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories are in 6 ounces of cooked salmon?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 kcal for farmed Atlantic salmon, cooked skinless.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 6 ounces of salmon?
faqs.a: About 38 g of protein, making it a great lean source.

faqs.q: Does wild salmon have fewer calories than farmed?
faqs.a: Yes, wild varieties often have ~140 kcal per 100 g vs. 206 kcal for farmed.
Negligible carbs (0 g per 100 g); it's primarily protein and healthy fats.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect salmon calories?
faqs.a: Baking or grilling keeps calories lower; frying with oil can add 40+ kcal per 100 g.
